intro: Seriphidium nutans, commonly known as the nodding tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Seriphidium nutans is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
